author: AHTRA ELNASHAR | The National Desk
title: chevron-right
text: {p}As Israel carries out its offensive in Gaza, its forces face another front to the north as skirmishes with Hezbollah fighters based in southern Lebanon escalate.{ }{/p}{p}Israeli Defense Minister Benny Gantz warned the Lebanese government if it doesn't push Hezbollah away from the border, \"the IDF will do so.\"{/p}{p}Hezbollah, which the United States designated as a foreign terrorist organization in 1997 and is backed by Iran, formed in the early 1980s in response to an Israeli invasion of Lebanon, according to the National Counterterrorism Center. Its fighters and Israeli forces began exchanging fire shortly after the October 7 Hamas attacks in Israel.{ }{/p}{p}Other Iran-backed groups, like the Houthis in Yemen, have taken retaliatory action for {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/top-videos/thousands-of-palestiniansflee-as-israeli-military-widens-operations-launches-new-strikes-in-central-gaza-refugees-nakba-displacement-rubble-hospitals-doctors-tents-winter-coastline-khan-younis-palestine-netanyahu-united-nations-phone-internet-middle-east\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/top-videos/thousands-of-palestiniansflee-as-israeli-military-widens-operations-launches-new-strikes-in-central-gaza-refugees-nakba-displacement-rubble-hospitals-doctors-tents-winter-coastline-khan-younis-palestine-netanyahu-united-nations-phone-internet-middle-east\"}Israel's offensive in Gaza{/a}, which has killed more than 21,000 people, according to the Gaza Ministry of Health under the Hamas-run government. The vast majority of victims are believed to be women and children.{ }{/p}{p}The World Health Organization recently carried out two{ }{a href=\"https://www.who.int/news/item/27-12-2023-who-teams-deliver-supplies-to-hospitals-in-northern-and-southern-gaza\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://www.who.int/news/item/27-12-2023-who-teams-deliver-supplies-to-hospitals-in-northern-and-southern-gaza\"}high-risk missions{/a}{ }that delivered supplies to hospitals in Gaza. According to WHO, Gaza has 13 partially functioning hospitals, two minimally functioning hospitals and 21 that are not able to operate at all.{ }{/p}{p}At Al-Amal Palestine Red Crescent Society in southern Gaza, \"WHO staff reported finding it impossible to walk inside the hospital without stepping over patients and those seeking refuge,\" the organization said.{ }{/p}{p}They also said there were only a few functioning toilets in the hospital and nearby community buildings for patients, staff and the 14,000 people taking refuge there.{/p}{p}The {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/nation-world/israeli-military-says-gaza-ground-offensive-has-expanded-into-urban-refugee-camps-hamas-terrorist-attacks-military-operations-war-october-7-attack-palestine-gaza-strip-israel-airstrikes\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/nation-world/israeli-military-says-gaza-ground-offensive-has-expanded-into-urban-refugee-camps-hamas-terrorist-attacks-military-operations-war-october-7-attack-palestine-gaza-strip-israel-airstrikes\"}human cost of the war{/a} and fears it will spread beyond Israel and Gaza, potentially even to Iran, have some world leaders {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/egypt-plan-end-israel-hamas-conflict-bibi-netanyahu-war-close-finished-cease-fire-hostages-release-gaza-strip-government-terrorists-airstrikes-buildings-families-refugee-rescue-prime-minister-benjamin-expanding\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/egypt-plan-end-israel-hamas-conflict-bibi-netanyahu-war-close-finished-cease-fire-hostages-release-gaza-strip-government-terrorists-airstrikes-buildings-families-refugee-rescue-prime-minister-benjamin-expanding\"}urging Israel{/a} to {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/un-security-council-approves-expedited-aid-to-gaza-excluding-ceasefire-call-suspension-of-hostilities-israel-hamas-war-united-states-russia-abstain-hostages-humanitarian-access-death-toll-palestinians-health-ministry\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/un-security-council-approves-expedited-aid-to-gaza-excluding-ceasefire-call-suspension-of-hostilities-israel-hamas-war-united-states-russia-abstain-hostages-humanitarian-access-death-toll-palestinians-health-ministry\"}pursue a ceasefire{/a}. The latest was French President Emmanuel Macron, who reiterated this position to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in a phone call this week.{ }{/p}{p}Macron told Netanyahu there needs to be work forward a lasting ceasefire \"with the help of all regional and international partners.\" He also said in the coming days, France and Jordan will work together on humanitarian efforts in Gaza .

author: Gloria Masallá
title: La lluvia modifica las cabalgatas de los Reyes Magos de la comarca
text:
[Sociedad](/actualidad/sociedad/)
La lluvia modifica las cabalgatas de los Reyes Magos de la comarca
Algeciras celebra el arrastre a las 11:00 y la cabalgata de Reyes a las 15:00 este domingo
La lluvia modifica las cabalgatas de Reyes
23:36
Compartir
El código iframe se ha copiado en el portapapeles
<iframe src="https://cadenaser.com/embed/audio/460/1735902412098/" width="100%" height="360" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
Algeciras
El Ayuntamiento de Tarifa ha anunciado el adelanto de la cabalgata de los Reyes Magos, al mismo domingo 5 de enero, pero por la mañana, debido a la previsión de lluvias. El arrastre de latas, que precede al desfile, comenzará a las 11:00 desde la plazoleta del Cinco de Oros hasta el centro, mientras que la cabalgata partirá a las 12:30 desde el Castillo de Guzmán el Bueno.
Por otra parte, el Ayuntamiento de Castellar ha decidido, adelantar las actividades a mañana, sábado 4 de enero. Tras los pronósticos de lluvia previstos, y pensando en la ilusión y disfrute de los más pequeños, consultado con Comisión de Fiestas, junto a padres y madres de los alumnos de 3° de Primaria del CEIP Tierno Galván, se decide adelantar la programación prevista para el Día de Reyes al Sábado 4 de Enero.
También ha decidido llevar los actos al sábado 4 de enero, el Ayuntamiento de Los Barrios. La delegada de Festejos de Los Barrios, May Gallego, ha informado de ello y los recorridos y horarios en Los Barrios, Palmones, Los Cortijillos y Guadacorte no sufrirán modificaciones.
Respecto a las recepciones y arrastre de latas, se celebrarán el domingo 5 de enero por la mañana.
El Ayuntamiento de La Línea de la Concepción se ha visto obligado a modificar la programación de Reyes, ante las alertas meteorológicas que anuncian precipitaciones para el domingo, 5 de enero, en horario de tarde. Ante esta situación se ha decidido que la Cabalgata de los Reyes Magos saldrá en horario de mañana, ante las previsiones meteorológicas que confirman precipitaciones por la tarde.
El viernes, 3 de enero, a las 19.00 horas, tendrá lugar la visita y recogida de cartas del Cartero Real. El recorrido partirá desde la Casa de la Cultura para continuar por la Plaza Fariñas, Alfonso X El Sabio, Plaza de la Iglesia, Arcos de Torres Vico, Avenida de España y Jardines Saccone.
La Cabalgata será a partir de las 12.00 horas, con salida desde la rotonda de Asansull, junto al Pabellón Polideportivo Municipal. El recorrido será el que estaba previsto inicialmente, discurriendo por Avenida del Ejército y Avenida de España.
Por la tarde, se modificará también todo el calendario previsto. Los Reyes Magos visitarán las iglesias de las distintas barriadas para que los más pequeños puedan disfrutar de ellos en un recinto cubierto.
El Ayuntamiento de Algeciras ha decidido adelantar el horario de la tradicional Cabalgata de Reyes, debido a las previsiones meteorológicas que indican lluvias para esta tarde y así, de cara a prevenir posibles contratiempos la salida de la cabalgata será a las 3 de la tarde. A su conclusión, si el tiempo lo permite, SSMM los Reyes Magos de Oriente, recibirán las peticiones de todos los niños, en el poblado navideño del parque María Cristina, en pleno centro de la ciudad.
El arrastre de latas comenzará con la recogida de dorsales a las 10:00 en la plaza Andalucía, 11:00 Llano Amarillo, a las 12:00 embarcarán los Reyes Magos en el Barco y a las 15:00 comenzará la cabalgata desde la Torre del Milenio.
En San Martín del Tesorillo se adelanta la cabalgata el domingo día 5 de enero a las cuatro de la tarde en vez de a las cinco como estaba previsto.
En Jimena de la Frontera, dadas las previsiones de lluvias para el próximo domingo día 5 por la tarde, el Ayuntamiento ha considerado oportuno adelantar la Cabalgata de Reyes en horario de mañana del domingo, a las 12:00 será la cabalgata y el arrastre de latas a las 10:00 de la mañana finalmente.
El punto de entrega de juguetes seguirá en el parque Praxedes, en horario de 9:00 a 11:00 horas del mismo día.
La Delegación de Fiestas del Ayuntamiento de San Roque, que dirige la teniente de alcalde María del Mar Collado, ha programado distintos actos en San Roque Ciudad de cara al próximo domingo 5 de enero, víspera de la Festividad de los Reyes Magos. La más destacada es la Cabalgata de Reyes, que partirá de Cuatro Vientos sobre las 17.30 horas.
Estos horarios eran los previstos, sin modificación, hasta el comienzo del programa Hoy por Hoy Campo de Gibraltar, según nos informaba Collado.
El primero de los actos tendrá lugar a las 11.00 horas en la Casa Consistorial, donde el alcalde, Juan Carlos Ruiz Boix, entregará a Sus Majestades de Oriente unas “llaves mágicas” que les permitirán entrar por la noche en todas la viviendas del municipio para depositar sus regalos. A continuación, Melchor, Gaspar y Baltasar se sumarán al arrastre de latas organizado en San Roque Ciudad, que comenzará frente a la Casa Consistorial y finalizará en la Alameda Alfonso XI.
Seguidamente, los Reyes Magos se desplazarán a la Residencia Municipal de Mayores, para hacer una visita a sus usuarios y usuarias. La última parada de la mañana será en los estudios de Canal San Roque RTVM, para ser entrevistados.
Por la tarde, a partir de las 17.30 horas, se desarrollará la tradicional Cabalgata de Reyes, que partirá de Cuatro Vientos, atravesará la calle Málaga y finalizará en la Alameda Alfonso XI. A su conclusión, los Reyes Magos se desplazarán al Teatro Juan Luis Galiardo, en cuya puerta recibirán a todos los niños y niñas que lo deseen. Además, todas las personas congregadas en la Alameda podrán degustar un trozo de roscón ofrecido desde el Ayuntamiento.
Hay que recordar que los Reyes Magos también estarán en las distintas barriadas del municipio en la jornada del domingo, protagonizando sus correspondientes recepciones y, en algunos casos, también cabalgatas. En estos núcleos de población también se repartirá el tradicional roscón de reyes.
En Ceuta la cabalgata de adelanta al sábado 4 de enero, partirá desde Maestranza a las 19:00 horas.

author: Jeffrey Clark
title: Gold Star mom surprises CNN anchor after revealing Biden hasn't reached out to her family | Fox News
text: Gold Star mother Christy Shamblin, whose daughter-in-law Marine Sgt. Nicole Gee was killed in a terrorist attack in Afghanistan, surprised a CNN anchor after saying President Biden has not reached out to her or her family despite her attempts to connect. When asked whether she believed that Biden was a \"consoler-in-chief,\" Shamblin said that was not her family's experience. \"He does talk to families that have lost loved ones because of his own experiences,\" CNN anchor Abby Phillip said to Shamblin, referring to tragic deaths in Biden's own family. PARENTS OF SOLDIER KILLED IN JORDAN REFLECT ON THEIR DAUGHTER'S LIFE: 'I JUST MISS HER' \"Have you spoken to him?\" Phillip added. \"No. He's not reached out to our family,\" she said. \"We've actually reached out to the White House and have never heard back. We asked to meet with them to understand where their thinking was in calling this a success, and we've not received a response. It's been months.\" \"I'm sorry to hear that,\" Phillip said in response. \"Shamblin's daughter-in-law, Marine Sergeant Nicole Gee, was one of the 13 American servicemembers killed in an ISIS-K terrorist attack at Abbey Gate during the Biden administration’s chaotic evacuation from Afghanistan in August 2021,\" according to the House Foreign Affairs Committee. Republican Chairman of the Foreign Affairs Committee, Texas Rep. Michael McCaul, said Tuesday that the Biden administration needed to take responsibility for the families affected by the withdrawal from Afghanistan. \"More than two years after the death of Christy’s daughter-in-law and 12 other U.S. servicemembers at Abbey Gate, the Biden administration still refuses to take accountability for the tragedy it caused,\" McCaul said in a statement. \"I hope Christy’s attendance sends a clear signal to President Biden and the American people that I will not rest until a complete and thorough investigation has occurred — and that people are held accountable for what happened.\" Shamblin will be one of McCaul's guests at the State of the Union address on Thursday, and she was asked what she wanted to hear from Biden in his speech. \"I want to hear how he's going to strengthen our armed forces and support them and answer our questions and lead to a thorough investigation like he promised, so we can move forward in a positive way and make it better,\" she said. The White House did not respond to a request for comment from Fox News Digital. GOLD STAR MOM CALLS BIDEN'S PRESENCE AT DIGNIFIED TRANSFER OF FALLEN SOLDIERS AN 'UNWANTED DISTRACTION' Behind closed doors, Biden strongly believes that he made the right decisions on the chaotic Afghanistan withdrawal in 2021 that led in part to the deaths of 13 American soldiers, according to a new book. An excerpt from \"The Internationalists: The Fight to Restore Foreign Policy After Trump,\" obtained by Axios, suggests that Biden remains defiant that the history books will look favorably on his decision to leave Afghanistan after American troops spent 20 years fighting the nation's longest war. President Biden's decision to pull troops from Afghanistan faced widespread global backlash after Taliban insurgents retook the country in a matter of days on Aug. 15, 2021, 20 years after their ouster by U.S.-led forces. Just a month earlier, Biden told Americans that a Taliban takeover was \"highly unlikely.\" Fox News' Nikolas Lanum contributed to this report. CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP

author: CNN Newsource
title: Justice Department says new Texas immigration law violates Constitution
text: Justice Department says new Texas immigration law violates Constitution By Priscilla Alvarez and Michael Williams, CNN Washington (CNN) — A new law that gives local law enforcement in Texas the authority to arrest migrants “violates the US Constitution,” the Department of Justice said in a letter to Gov. Greg Abbott on Thursday, threatening to sue unless Abbott backs down from enforcing it. The letter, obtained by CNN, marks the latest escalation between President Joe Biden and Abbott over the handling of the US-Mexico border. Earlier this month, Abbott, a Republican, signed into law the measure, known as [ Senate Bill 4](https://www.cnn.com/2023/12/19/politics/white-house-response-texas-law/index.html), which gives local law enforcement the power to arrest migrants and gives judges the ability to issue orders to remove people from the United States. The White House slammed the law, calling it “incredibly extreme.” It’s expected to take effect in March. Principal deputy assistant attorney general Brian Boynton said in his letter to Abbott Thursday that “the United States intends to file suit to enjoin the enforcement of SB 4 unless Texas agrees to refrain from enforcing the law.” While the federal government is “committed to … securing the border,” Boynton wrote, the Texas law is “contrary to these goals.” Abbott slammed the Justice Department’s letter later Thursday and accused President Joe Biden of “destroying America.” “The Biden Admin. not only refuses to enforce current U.S. immigration laws, they now want to stop Texas from enforcing laws against illegal immigration,” Abbott said in a post on X. “I’ve never seen such hostility to the rule of law in America.” The ongoing surge of migrants at the US-Mexico border has placed immense pressure on local and federal resources. Thursday’s legal threat follows a DOJ lawsuit against Texas earlier this year over the state’s use of [ floating barriers in the Rio Grande](https://www.cnn.com/2023/09/07/politics/texas-water-barriers-migrants-appeal/index.html). That lawsuit is still making its way through the courts. The enforcement of immigration law is a federal responsibility, and opponents of the Texas measure argue it’s unconstitutional. The law has sent ripples of fear throughout the Latino community in Texas, which makes up [40% of the state’s population](https://www.census.gov/quickfacts/fact/table/TX/POP010210). Civil-rights groups, including the American Civil Liberties Union, [filed a lawsuit](https://www.aclu.org/press-releases/aclu-civil-rights-orgs-sue-texas-over-sb-4) seeking to block the measure. The Justice Department’s threat to sue comes on the heels of a [high-levels talks ](https://www.cnn.com/2023/12/27/politics/blinken-mayorkas-mexico-border-crossing-biden/index.html)between senior US and Mexican officials this week Officials from both countries described talks as productive, and Mexican officials are [expected to visit Washington ](https://www.cnn.com/2023/12/28/politics/mexican-officials-washington-meeting-biden-administration/index.html)next month to continue the discussions. This story has been updated with additional information. CNN’s Kaanita Iyer contributed to this report. The-CNN-Wire ™ & © 2023 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

author: @beforeitsnews
title: Starlink ruffles some feathers in Italy’s telco industry | Motor Junkies | Before It's News
text:
Starlink ruffles some feathers in Italy’s telco industry
Starlink’s arrival seems to have ruffled some feathers in Italy’s telco industry.
Last month, Italy’s Undersecretary to the Prime Minister’s Office, Allessio Butti, shared that the country was preparing to test SpaceX’s Starlink services in remote areas. Italy’s telco association recently urged the government to review regulations for low-earth orbit satellite broadband operators before Starlink’s arrival.
A lobby group in Italy called Asstel submitted a document to the government outlining its concerns about Starlink.
Asstel states in the document that Italy’s existing rules for low-orbit satellite broadband operators do not consider SpaceX’s business model, which offers consumers devices to customers directly. The lobby group also pointed out that SpaceX’s Starlink services compete directly with local telecom operators.
Asstel noted that the government should consider regulations over the use of frequencies and how it can enforce the rules to encourage companies to comply with them. The lobby group also brought up the storage of sensitive data, suggesting that the
[government should impose regulations](/v3/r2/?url=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGVzbGFyYXRpLmNvbS9zdGFybGluay1jcmltaW5hbC1jaGFyZ2VzLW5ldy16ZWFsYW5kLyNnb29nbGVfdmlnbmV0dGU=) for local storage.
According to
[Reuters](/v3/r2/?url=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucmV1dGVycy5jb20vYnVzaW5lc3MvbWVkaWEtdGVsZWNvbS9pdGFseXMtdGVsY29zLWNhbGwtc2F0ZWxsaXRlLWJyb2FkYmFuZC1ydWxlcy1zdGFybGluay1sb29tcy0yMDI0LTExLTIwLw==), Asstel’s document was an internal memo shared with a few politicians in Italy.
The Teslarati team would appreciate hearing from you. If you have any tips, contact me at
[[email protected]](/v3/r2/?url=bWFpbHRvOm1hcmlhQHRlc2xhcmF0aS5jb20=) or via Twitter [@Writer_01001101](https://twitter.com/Writer_01001101).
The post
[Starlink ruffles some feathers in Italy’s telco industry](/v3/r2/?url=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGVzbGFyYXRpLmNvbS9zdGFybGluay1pdGFseS10ZWxjby1hc3NvY2lhdGlvbi8=) appeared first on [TESLARATI](/v3/r2/?url=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGVzbGFyYXRpLmNvbQ==).
Source:
[https://www.teslarati.com/starlink-italy-telco-association/](/v3/r2/?url=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGVzbGFyYXRpLmNvbS9zdGFybGluay1pdGFseS10ZWxjby1hc3NvY2lhdGlvbi8=)
